page.title: 01 INTRODUCTION
page.content: Our 'square' covers a densely populated area south-west of London, bordered by generous green open spaces. It covers three main neighbourhoods of the London Borough of Richmond-upon-Thames - East Sheen, Barnes and Mortlake. It is a 'desirable' residential area, a fact that is reflected in local property prices. This is due as much to the proximity of natural amenities (Richmond Park is partly in our square as are Barnes and Palewell Commons, and Kew Gardens are near), as to the closeness of London: Waterloo is 20 minutes by train. The nearness of TV and other media centres accounts for the many residents involved in such work. The South Circular Road, and Heathrow's flight-path, have some blighting effect on this locality.
